label: [I2C] controlling Scroll pHAT board
info: ## Flow for a Scroll pHAT board Inspired by the [Node-RED flow one](https://flowhub.org/f/be2109bba90b6c5a) and [two](https://flowhub.org/f/81d46dabe68094e4) [Scroll pHAT](https://www.adafruit.com/product/3017) is a 11x5 LED board that is connected to an I2C bus and can be controlled via that. This flow runs on an Raspberry Pi 4B using Erlang-Red in a docker image. ## Protocol See [specs](https://cdn-shop.adafruit.com/product-files/3017/31FL3730.pdf) for details. To set Brightness 0x19 (25) is the command. To set the mode must be (0b11) 3 - 5x11 matrix LED, command is zero. To toggle the LEDs, use command 1 (0x01) to 11 (0x0b). ## Discussion What this flow shows is two different possibilities of addressing the Scroll pHAT. One is to use the command 1 and set all LED columns at once. I send 12 byte values representing each column (0b11111 - all on, 0b00000 - all off) plus a final value 255 to refresh the matrix. What happens is that the registers for each column and then a refresh is triggered by the 255 at the end. The second method is to update each register for each column individually and then post a final refresh to command 0x0c (12).
